alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 16 at 7:56PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Yukon River at Tanana * WHEN...Through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Ice jam flooding is possible at Tanana through Wednesday. If an ice jam forms, water will rise very rapidly and people may need to evacuate to higher ground at a moments notice. Prepare your community now for flooding, and where possible, move items to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The River Watch Team reports the breakup front moved past Tanana Tuesday afternoon, with an approximately 120 mile run of bank-to-bank ice chunks and pans. In place ice sheets downriver from Tanana are weakening, but there is still the possibility of an ice jam forming. In addition, water levels will rise to bankfull levels due to the high volume of ice and water associated with the ice run moving past the community. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Yukon River near Tanana stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
